actions.text: On agreeing to the Gutierrez amendment (A006) Failed by voice vote.

description: Amendment sought to add language to the findings section of the bill to clarify that Congress recognizes that Puerto Rico is sociologically and culturally a Carribbean and Latin-American nation with a distinctive culture that has Spanish as a common language.
purpose: An amendment numbered 36 as printed in the Congressional Record to clarify that Congress recognizes that Puerto Rico is sociologically and culturally a Carribbean and Latin-American nation with a distinctive culture that has Spanish as a common language.
